text.p: Placer Dome Inc said Monday it was studying with interest a proposal from takeover target Highlands Gold Ltd of Australia and planned to issue a response later.
"We're interested in their proposal and we're studying it," said Placer spokesman Hugh Leggatt.
He said the Vancouver gold miner expected to give its response during Australian business hours.
Highlands earlier offered to sell its 25 percent stake in the Porgera gold mine in Papua New Guinea to Placer and spin off the rest of its assets into a new company.
Highlands said the restructuring would give shareholders substantially greater value than Placer's A$0.75 a share bid. Its board continued to urge shareholders to reject that bid.
Last month Placer offered to buy Highlands' stake in Porgera for A$276.8 million. Placer already holds a separate 25 percent stake in Porgera through its Placer Pacific Ltd unit.
